gurmukhi: BUpq prm gXwn jb DwXo ]mn bc krm kTn krqw ko jO kir DXwn lgwXo ]
transliteration: Bhoopat Parm Gyaan Jab Dhaayo|| Man Bach Karam Kathan Kartaa Ko Jau Kar(i) Dhyaan Lagadyo||
translation: When the king obtained the Supreme knowledge, he had earlier performed rigorous austerities for the realization of the Lord, with his mind, speech and action;

gurmukhi: kr bhu nXws kTn jpu swDXo drSin dIXo BvwnI ]qq iCn prm gXwn aupdysXo lok cqur ds rwnI ]
transliteration: Kar Bahu Nyaas Kathan Jap(u) Saadhyo Darshan(i) Deeyo Bhavaanee|| Tat Chin Param Gyaan Oupdesyo Lok Chatur Das Raanee||
translation: When he performed various kinds of difficult postures and the repetition of God’s Name, then the goddess Bhavani appeared before him; she, the mistress of all the fourteen worlds instructed him regarding Supreme Knowledge;

gurmukhi: iqh iCn srb SwsqR muK aucry q`q Aq`q pCwnw ]Avr Aq`q sBY kr jwny eyk q`q Thrwnw ]
transliteration: Tih Chhin Sarab Shaastra Moukh Ouchre Tatt Atatt Pachhaadaa|| Avar Atatt Sabhai Kar Jaane Ek Tatt Thahraanaa||
translation: The king obtained the recognition of essence and non-essence at the same moment and he recited all the Shastras from his mouth; considering all the elements as destructible, he accepted only one Essence as indestructible;

gurmukhi: AnBv joq AnUp pRkwSI Anhd nwd bjwXo ]dys ibdys jIq rwjn kh suBt ABY pd pwXo ]17]91]
transliteration: Abhav Jot Anoop Prakaadhianhad Naad Bajaayo|| Des Bides Jeet Raajan Kah Soubhat Abhai Pad Paayo||17||91||
translation: Perceiving the unique Light of the Supreme Soul, he blissfully blew he Unstruck Melody; he achieved the fearless state on conquering the kings of all the countries far and near.17.91.

gurmukhi: AYsy Amr pd khu pwie ]dys Aaur ibdys BUpq jIq lIn bulwie ]
transliteration: Aise Amar Pad Kauh Paae|| Des Aur Bides Bhoopat Jeet Leen Bulaae||
translation: In this was, achieving the everlasting state, disciplining the kings of various countries, he invited them;

gurmukhi: BwNiq BwNiq Bry gumwn inSwn srb bjwie ]caup caup cly cmUM pq ic`q caup bFwie ]
transliteration: Bhaant(i) Bhaant(i) Bhare Goumaan Nishaan Sarab Bajaae|| Chaoup Chaoup Chale Chamoond Pat Chitt Chaoup Badhaae||
translation: They, getting pleased marched proudly towards Parasnath, sounding their trumpets;

gurmukhi: Awn Awn sBY lgy pg BUp ky juhrwie ]Awv Awv suBwv so kih lIn kMT lgwie ]
transliteration: Aan Aan Sabhai Lage Pag Bhoop Ke Juhraae|| Aav Aav Soubhaav So Kah(i) Leen Kanth Lagade||
translation: They all came and bowed at the feet of the Sovereign, who welcomed them all and hugged them;

gurmukhi: hIr cIr subwj dy gj rwj dY pihrwie ]swD dY snmwn kY kr lIn ic`q curwie ]18]92]
transliteration: Heer Cheer Soubaaj De Gad Raaj Dai Paihraae|| Saadh Dai Sanmaan Kai Kar Leen Chitt Churaae||18||92||
translation: He gave them ornaments, garments, elephants, horses etc. and in this way, honouring all of them, he allured their mind.18.92.

gurmukhi: iem kr dwn dY snmwn ]BwNiq BwNiq ibmoih BUpq BUp bu`D inSwn ]
transliteration: Im Kar Daan Dai Sanmaan|| Bhaant(i) Bhaant(i) Bimoh(i) Bhoopat Bhoop Buddh Nishaan||
translation: In this way, giving them gifts and honouring them, Parashnath, the store of wisdom, fascinated the mind of all;
